title: "The Vlog... Is Over": YouTuber Adam The Woo Shared Holiday Video Before Death
content: YouTuber and travel vlogger Adam Williams, popularly known as Adam the Woo, left fans in shock after posting a cheerful holiday video just a day before his body was discovered at his Florida home.

title: Girl, 6, Dies A Month After Dog Bite Despite Treatment In Maharashtra
content: A six-year-old girl from Maharashtra's Thane died over a month after being bitten by a street dog, a civic official said on Wednesday.

title: 'I Stay In Delhi For 2 Days, Get Infection': Nitin Gadkari Flags Toxic Air
content: Delhi's toxic air has drawn strong remarks from within the ruling BJP, with Union Minister Nitin Gadkari saying that two days in the national capital gives him an infection.

title: 2 Days After Russian General's Assassination, 2 Cops Killed Near Moscow Site
content: Three people were killed by a bomb on Wednesday in Moscow after two police officers approached a man acting suspiciously near the site where a senior general was killed two days ago by a car bomb that Russia said was planted by Ukraine.

title: Telangana Shocker: Official's Assets Estimated To Be Over 100 Crores
content: The Telangana Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) has registered a case against the deputy transport commissioner of Mahabubnagar district for possessing assets wildly disproportionate to his known sources of income.

title: Co-Conspirators To Mentions Of Trump, What Latest Jeffrey Epstein Files Say
content: The latest Jeffrey Epstein documents reveal that investigators were exploring charges against those beyond Epstein and his former partner, Ghislaine Maxwell. Emails from July 2019 mention "10 co-conspirators."

title: Split In Opposition In Mumbai Civic Polls, Main Parties To Contest Separately
content: The opposition Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) in Maharashtra, which fought last year's Lok Sabha elections and the Assembly elections together, has now gone for a split in the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Is Congress Looking At A Rahul-Priyanka-Sachin Pilot Troika For 2029?
content: The Congress is undergoing a big churn that may see a meatier and bigger role for Priyanka Gandhi Vadra.

title: Army Officer Dies In Firing Inside Military Camp In J&K
content: A junior Commissioned Officer of the army has been killed in a firing incident inside an army camp in Samba district of Jammu and Kashmir. An investigation has been launched to ascertain the nature of the firing incident.

title: Cousins Uddhav Thackeray, Raj To Make Reunion Official Shortly
content: Uddhav Thackeray's faction of Shiv Sena is going ahead full steam with Raj Thackeray's MNS for the civic elections in Mumbai.

title: China In Historic Military Buildup, US Increasingly Vulnerable: Pentagon
content: The Chinese military is in the midst of a "historic military buildup" that has made the US homeland "increasingly vulnerable," according to the latest edition of a Pentagon report on the capabilities of the Chinese military

title: No More H-1B Lottery, US Notifies New Process For Work Visas
content: The Donald Trump administration in the United States has announced that it is replacing its longstanding H-1B work visa lottery system with a new weighted approach that prioritises skilled, higher-paid foreign workers.

title: "Significant Stride In India's Space Sector": PM Modi On LVM3 Rocket Launch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday congratulated ISRO for placing the heaviest satellite in orbit from India using the LVM3 rocket and strengthening the foundation for future missions such as the Gaganyaan.

title: 30 Indians Living Illegally In US Arrested By Immigration Agents
content: US border patrol agents have arrested 30 Indian nationals, living illegally in America, operating semitrucks with commercial driver's licenses.

title: Vande Bharat Driver Spots Auto On Kerala Track, Applies Emergency Brake
content: A major accident was narrowly avoided when a Vande Bharat Express train spotted an auto rickshaw on the railway track near Akathumuri Halt station in this district.

title: Tribe Names In ST Certificates Of Some Manipur Government Staff Don't Exist In Official List: RTI
content: The Scheduled Tribes (ST) certificates of some employees in Manipur government departments have names of tribes that do not exist in the state's official list of ST cleared by parliament, according to information obtained via the RTI Act.

title: 9 Missions, 9 Success Stories: ISRO's LVM3 Has A 100% Success Rate
content: LVM3 has a 100 per cent success rate across all its eight previous missions, including Chandrayaan-2, Chandrayaan-3, and two OneWeb missions carrying 72 satellites.

title: Old Grudges That Separated The Thackeray Cousins And What Reunited Them
content: Back in 2013, Uddhav Thackeray extended an olive branch by proposing reconciliation through his newspaper Saamna, only for Raj Thackeray to dismiss the gesture completely.

title: Bengaluru Woman Groped, Slapped For Rejecting "Instagram Friend's" Advances
content: A 21-year-old woman was allegedly assaulted and harassed in broad daylight by a man who had been persistently pressuring her to enter into a relationship, an incident that was captured on CCTV in Bengaluru.

title: New Epstein Files Dump Shows Child-Themed Artwork, Weird Decor
content: The US Department of Justice has released new documents and photographs from the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein's townhouse.

title: Koepka leaving LIV Golf, cites family reasons
content: Five-time major champion Brooks Koepka is stepping away from LIV Golf, effective immediately, his representatives said Tuesday.

title: Jokic: Flagg 'really mature' in leading Mavs to win
content: Cooper Flagg had the best long-range shooting performance of his young career and left an impression on three-time MVP Nikola Jokic with his performance down the stretch Tuesday night.

title: Spurs' defense throttles OKC as rivalry grows
content: The Spurs beat the Thunder for the second time in 10 days after again overwhelming the defending champions with physicality and speed.

title: Lakers' Redick blunt: Effort, defense 'a choice'
content: Los Angeles' defense was shredded in the third quarter of a 132-108 loss to Phoenix on Tuesday night.

title: Nuggets forward Johnson to have MRI on knee
content: Nuggets forward Cameron Johnson is set to undergo an MRI on his right knee after suffering what the Nuggets called a sprain in Tuesday's loss in Dallas.

title: Perryman loses appeal, to miss Chargers' final 2
content: Denzel Perryman's two-game suspension for "repeated violations of playing rules intended to protect the health and safety of players" was upheld by hearing officer Jordy Nelson on Tuesday.

title: QB Fields' season over with Jets future uncertain
content: The Jets are placing quarterback Justin Fields on season-ending injured reserve with a knee injury that has sidelined him the past three games.

title: ðŸ’“ Venus Williams, Andrea Preti tie the knot
content: Williams and Preti became wife and husband over the weekend in Palm Beach, Florida, as part of a five-day celebration.

content: We are following the 2025 NFL season's playoff picture. Here's how things look right now for wild-card spots, division races and even the draft order.

content: His decision to play for Syracuse felt like a coronation. Now, he's out to prove he's more than Carmelo's son.

title: Men's: UConn supplants Duke as fourth No. 1 seed
content: The Huskies return to the top line as Duke drops to a 2-seed after suffering its first loss of the season.

content: A decisive win over Tennessee put Louisville solidly inside the top 16 -- and dropped the Lady Vols to a 6-seed.

content: Who says the baseball offseason slows down for the holidays? Let's remember some free agent signings and trades.

content: From signature holes to a bigger and better putting green, the TGL is ready for the start of the 2026 season.

content: How and when would the WNBPA executive committee vote to strike? What would that entail? What benefits would be lost?

content: Strasbourg now exists as a training ground for Chelsea prospects, akin to baseball's farm system. Is this the future of European soccer?

content: Just before we hit the crowded festive fixtures, we have plenty to overreact to in the Premier League.

content: The tournament starts Thursday, with the best under-20 players in hockey. Here are gold medal favorites, players set to break out.

content: As the holiday break approaches, the Maple Leafs aren't exactly excelling. Plus, key games in the week ahead.

content: All of the free agent options worth adding as we dive into Week 17 and the fantasy football championships.

content: Bowl season could be the last chance to back some beloved underdogs -- here's how to do it with all the chaos.

title: The Wet Bandits: Lauri Markkanen, Jazz VP dress as 'Home Alone' duo
content: The Utah Jazz star appropriately took the role of Marv Murchins, while Evan Phillips dressed as Harry Lyme.

content: The transfer window is set to open across Europe in January, so what are the top clubs planning? Who comes in? Who will go?

title: No one likes Gunther, Austin Theory joins The Vision
content: WWE fans already were out on Gunther for retiring John Cena. Now it's clear his fellow wrestlers are, too.

title: Pickups: Raynaud, Landale among several quality center options
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: 'Won't bow down': Thackeray cousins reunite after 20yrs for BMC polls; present united front
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS have announced an alliance for upcoming BMC and other civic body elections, marking a political reunion of Thackeray cousins Uddhav and Raj. Seat-sharing agreements have been finalized, with the NCP (SP) also included in some discussions. This move is seen as a significant development in Maharashtra politics.

title: 'Wanted to kill myself': Unnao rape survivor protests Kuldeep Sengar bail; calls it 'injustice'
content: Unnao rape survivor protested at India Gate after Kuldeep Singh Sengar's bail, fearing for her safety and alleging political motives linked to upcoming elections. She expressed betrayal by the system but retained faith in the Supreme Court. Sengar's bail was suspended pending appeal, though he remains in custody due to a separate conviction.

title: 'You had Osman Hadi killed': Kin makes big claim against Yunus; alleges plot to 'sabotage' polls
content: The brother of slain youth leader Sharif Osman Hadi accused Bangladeshâ€™s interim government of orchestrating his killing to destabilise the country and sabotage the February elections. Speaking at protests in Dhaka, he said Hadi was targeted for supporting timely polls and refusing outside pressure, warning of continued agitation unless swift justice is delivered.

title: VHT: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi becomes youngest centurion; smashes 36-ball hundred
content: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi has electrified the Vijay Hazare Trophy, smashing a 36-ball century against Arunachal Pradesh on Wednesday. This remarkable feat makes him the youngest List-A centurion ever.  The young prodigy's explosive batting, including a conversion to 150 in 59 balls, signals a potential shift in Indian domestic cricket's landscape.

title: Indian woman murdered in Toronto: Suspect identified, image released; what we know so far
content: Toronto police are searching for Abdul Ghafoori, the main suspect in the murder of 30-year-old Indian national Himanshi Khurana. Her body was discovered in a residence near Strachan Avenue and Wellington Street West. Authorities are treating the incident as intimate partner violence, and a Canada-wide warrant has been issued for Ghafoori's arrest.

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman predicts â€˜sky-highâ€™ salaries by 2035, but only after â€¦.
content: In a forward-looking address, OpenAI's Sam Altman shared his vision for 2035, where graduates could embark on lucrative careers, possibly even in space exploration, as AI reshapes the employment landscape. He admires the current generation of young workers, seeing them as pioneers at the dawn of extraordinary possibilities.

title: â€˜Groped, slapped, stalkedâ€™: Man assaults woman after she rejects his proposal; CCTV captures attack
content: A 21-year-old woman was stalked and assaulted by a man she met on Instagram in Bengaluru. The accused, Naveen Kumar, allegedly harassed her after she rejected his advances. He intercepted her and attacked her, leading to his arrest by Jnanabharathi police.

title: Exclusive | Naseem Shah on criticism: 'Fans have never held a ball... you don't take it to heart'
content: Pakistan fast bowler Naseem Shah reflects on the challenges of T20 cricket, his journey through injuries and scrutiny, and his current positive outlook with the Desert Vipers in the ILT20. He emphasises on continuous learning, mental resilience against criticism, and the unique difficulties faced by bowlers in a batter-dominated era.

title: Salesforce reboots AI strategy: Model errors raise concerns
content: Salesforce is scaling back its reliance on large language models due to reliability issues, shifting focus to deterministic automation in its Agentforce product. Executives acknowledge a decline in trust in AI models, with reported instances of models omitting instructions and losing focus. This strategic pivot follows significant support staff reductions attributed to AI agent deployment.

title: â€˜Discuss atrocities against minoritiesâ€™: Jamia suspends professor; orders probe over exam question
content: Jamia Millia Islamia University has suspended a faculty member from its Social Work department following complaints about an end-semester examination paper. The paper, titled "Social Problems in India," faced criticism on social media for alleged ideological bias and a one-sided narrative. An inquiry committee has been formed to investigate the matter.

title: Google Cloud chief backs Nvidiaâ€™s stance after Google TPU news wipes billions off its market value
content: Google Cloud chief executive officer Thomas Kurian dismisses talk of a 'chip war' with Nvidia. He states Google and Nvidia are partners, not rivals.  Google's custom AI chips and Nvidia's GPUs work together.  This approach balances performance and cost for AI models.  Nvidia maintains its industry lead in AI chip technology.

title: â€˜Completely unfitâ€™: Humayun Kabir removes influencer from candidate list; explains why
content: Janata Unnayan Party's Ballygunge candidate Nisha Chatterjee was dropped by MLA Humayun Kabir within 24 hours due to "inappropriate social media posts." Chatterjee, a social media influencer, has threatened legal action for defamation, accusing Kabir of a "sham" secular party promise and attempting to divide communities.

title: Bank holiday Christmas: Will banks remain shut today & tomorrow? - check state-wise list
content: Confused about bank operations this Christmas? While Christmas Day sees nationwide closures, Christmas Eve is a holiday only in Mizoram, Nagaland, and Meghalaya. Other state-specific holidays also affect banking. Plan ahead for branch visits, as digital services remain accessible. Check local lists to avoid festive season disruptions.

title: 'Deflating tyres of bicycles': Principalâ€™s orders senior students to beat Class 7 boy; booked
content: A Kompally government school principal faces a criminal case for allegedly ordering four Class 10 students to assault a Class 7 boy. The victim, who sustained back injuries, reported the incident to his parents, leading to a police complaint. Authorities suspect the principal believed the younger student deflated bicycle tires in the parking lot. Investigations are ongoing.

title: Paul Rudd reacts to Travis Kelceâ€™s apology after Chiefsâ€™ playoff exit
content: Actor Paul Rudd shared his perspective on the Kansas City Chiefs' season. He highlighted the joy and memories the team has provided his family. Rudd embraced the team's elimination from playoff contention. He wished Patrick Mahomes a speedy recovery. Rudd also humorously suggested players deserved a break after a long season. He stated he was not too upset.

title: Who is Brittani? Inside Aaron Rodgersâ€™ wife as marriage mystery deepens
content: Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers has found unexpected peace in his marriage to Brittani.  Unlike his previous public relationships, Brittani values privacy.  Rodgers credits his wife with providing unconditional love and stability.  This new chapter sees a calmer, more focused Rodgers as he navigates his final NFL years.  His teammates and coaches notice the positive change.

title: Shane McMahon and Marissa Mazzolaâ€™s combined net worth in 2025
content: Shane and Marissa Mazzola-McMahon possess a combined net worth of $650 million, largely attributed to Shane's decades with WWE and his diversified business ventures. While Shane's wealth stems from his executive roles, on-camera presence, and equity in WWE, Marissa's career in film production and PR augments their family fortune.

title: Wellness Wednesday: Social media myth buster- 'more protein is always better'
content: Social media's protein obsession is misleading. Experts clarify that excessive protein intake offers no extra benefits and can strain kidneys, especially for those with existing health issues.  Balanced nutrition, not extremes, is key.  Regular exercise is crucial for the body to effectively utilize protein for muscle repair and growth, ensuring overall well-being.

title: Illicit affair, hired shooter: How woman gave â€˜supariâ€™ to kill husband; body dumped near expressway
content: Dausa police have arrested a 35-year-old woman, Shweta alias Shilpi Sharma, for orchestrating the contract killing of her husband. The investigation, triggered by the discovery of an unidentified body, revealed the murder was motivated by an illicit relationship. The main conspirator and hired killer are also in custody.

title: 7 ways the human body reacts in life or death situations
content: Life or death situations trigger automatic survival responses. The body prioritizes escape and defense, overriding comfort and logic. Adrenaline and stress hormones reorganize brain activity, enhancing threat detection. This leads to altered time perception, suppressed pain, narrowed vision, and temporary strength. Memories become fragmented, and shaking may follow. These involuntary reactions are the body's fight for survival.

title: Will AI take our jobs, or is the bubble about to burst? Hereâ€™s what the Salesforce story tells us
content: Rising fears about AI-driven job losses are colliding with a more complex reality. Using Salesforce as a case study, the story examines how early confidence in large language models has given way to concerns over reliability, accountability, and trust. The companyâ€™s layoffs and subsequent pullback from AI-first rhetoric reveal that automation is reshaping work unevenly, exposing organisational choices as much as technological limits.

title: Internet suspended, curfew imposed: What triggered unrest in Assam's Karbi Anglong
content: Violent protests over alleged illegal non-tribal settlements in Assam's Karbi Anglong region have resulted in two deaths and dozens injured. Tensions over land rights escalated, leading to clashes between tribal protesters and security forces. The state government has imposed restrictions and suspended mobile internet services.

title: Watch: Group of men harass street vendors selling Santa caps; video goes viral
content: Police are investigating a viral video depicting men intimidating street vendors selling Santa hats in Puri. The men questioned the vendors' origins and religion, demanding they cease selling festive items and suggesting they sell religious merchandise instead. The incident has sparked outrage online, with many condemning it as an attack on communal harmony.

title: 'India continues to soar higher': PM hails Isro's BlueBird Block-2 satellite launch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded Isro's successful launch of the US communications satellite BlueBird Block-2, calling it a proud milestone for India's space sector. The LVM3 rocket, carrying the heaviest satellite launched from Indian soil, demonstrated India's heavy-lift capability and commitment to self-reliance, strengthening its global commercial launch market role.

title: Ashes hangover? ECB probes England players' drinking after videos surface â€“ watch
content: England's cricket chief Rob Key is investigating reports of excessive player drinking during the Ashes tour's mid-series break. Videos emerged showing Ben Duckett appearing disoriented and Jacob Bethell in a nightclub. While Key stated he expects responsible behavior, initial feedback suggests players were well-behaved, with only occasional drinks.  He emphasised that over-indulgence would be addressed.

title: 'Policy decision': US judge refuses to scrap Trumpâ€™s $100,000 H-1B visa fee
content: A US federal judge upheld the Trump administration's $100,000 fee on new H-1B visas, rejecting a lawsuit by the Chamber of Commerce. The judge ruled President Trump had the legal authority to impose the fee, citing concerns that the program was displacing American workers. This decision impacts tech companies and businesses relying on skilled foreign talent.

title: Bollywood celebs, Queen Elizabeth-2 cruise: YouTuber's Dubai wedding on ED watch
content: Unnao YouTuber Anurag Dwivedi, under ED scrutiny for alleged money laundering, hosted a lavish Dubai wedding for over 130 guests.  The extravagant celebrations, including flights, visas, and accommodation, occurred aboard the Queen Elizabeth-2 cruise. This opulent event has attracted significant public and official attention amidst the ongoing financial probe.

title: BMC polls: Thackeray brothersâ€™ deal finalised; 145â€“150 seats for Shiv Sena (UBT), 65â€“70 for MNS
content: Uddhav and Raj Thackeray are set to formally announce their political alliance for upcoming municipal elections on Wednesday.  The Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS have finalized seat-sharing arrangements for Mumbai and other corporations, aiming to unite for the Marathi manoos.  Discussions with NCP (SP) are ongoing, while Congress will contest BMC polls independently.

title: Earthâ€™s accidental space shield and the changing face of near Earth radiation
content: Human radio waves have inadvertently altered Earth's radiation belts, creating an unexpected barrier that modifies radiation behavior. While solar storms can rapidly create temporary, powerful radiation belts, human activity has caused a more subtle, long-term change. This dual influence necessitates a reevaluation of space environment models for future space exploration and technology.

title: Dhurandhar: Ranveer Singh film nears Rs 1,000cr milestone
content: Spy thriller 'Dhurandhar' continues its phenomenal box office run, nearing Rs 900 crore worldwide. The Ranveer Singh starrer has achieved an unprecedented streak of 17 consecutive days with over Rs 20 crore collections, surpassing legendary films. Experts anticipate it will cross the Rs 1000 crore mark, a career first for Singh.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 near 26,150; BSE Sensex below 85,500
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Wednesday. While Nifty50 was near 25,150, BSE Sensex was below 85,500.

title: Libya's military chief killed in Turkey plane crash; debris located near village
content: Libya's army chief, Lt Gen Mohamed Al-Haddad, and four others died in a plane crash returning from an official visit to Turkey. The Falcon 50 business jet lost contact shortly after departing Ankara, having declared an electrical emergency. Turkish authorities are investigating the tragic accident.

title: Selfie scramble! Fans swarm Rohit Sharma after nets; security steps in â€“ watch
content: Rohit Sharma's return to domestic cricket in Jaipur for the Vijay Hazare Trophy has drawn significant fan attention. A video showed fans crowding him for selfies after a net session. This has led to heightened security measures for his upcoming matches. Organisers expect large crowds eager to watch the star player.

title: Pushed, beaten with log: 54-year-old teacher killed by husband in Bengaluru; staged it as accident
content: A 64-year-old electrician has been arrested for allegedly murdering his 54-year-old teacher-wife in Bengaluru. He reportedly pushed her off his motorcycle and beat her with a wooden log, then claimed she fell. Doctors' suspicions about her injuries led to his arrest and confession, citing financial disputes.

title: UAE weather forecast: Humid mornings, fog, light rain expected from 23rd to 27th Dec
content: The UAE will experience humid mornings with chances of fog or mist from Tuesday, 23rd December, to Saturday, 27th December. Skies will be fair to partly cloudy, with clouds over islands and some coastal areas. Light rain is possible on Thursday and Friday. Winds will be light to moderate, and seas slight to moderate, occasionally rough in the Arabian Gulf.

title: Perez Hilton slams Prince Harry and Meghan Markleâ€™s Archewell charity rebrand
content: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's Archewell Foundation has rebranded to Archewell Philanthropies, sparking scrutiny over its operational structure and finances. Critics, including Perez Hilton, question the shift to a fiscal sponsor model and highlight a significant imbalance between expenses and grants awarded, raising concerns about transparency and the foundation's charitable impact.

title: Epstein files out: Trump referenced in some newly released docs; DOJ calls claims 'untrue'
content: The US Justice Department has unveiled nearly 30,000 additional documents concerning Jeffrey Epstein. These files mention President Trump, including an email detailing his flights on Epstein's private jet in the 1990s. The DOJ clarified that some claims against Trump are unsubstantiated and were submitted before the 2020 election, emphasizing their lack of credibility.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for December 24, 2025 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi's Mehul Kothari recommends CEAT, Endurance Technologies, and HPL Electric & Power for purchase. These stocks are showing signs of reversal and stabilization at key support levels, with favorable risk-reward ratios for potential upside moves within a 30-60 day timeframe.

title: Uninvited guest: Lecturer quits job, turns full-time thief; how she robbed wedding guests
content: A former guest lecturer, Revathi, has been arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly stealing gold ornaments and cash from wedding functions by posing as a relative. Police recovered 262 grams of gold worth Rs 32 lakh after her arrest. She confessed to multiple thefts, citing financial pressures as her motive.

title: IND vs NZ: No Williamson! New Zealand announce squads for India series
content: New Zealand have named ODI and T20I squads for their India tour, using the series to prepare for the 2026 T20 World Cup. Mitchell Santner will captain the T20Is, with Michael Bracewell leading the ODIs. Several senior players return, young talents earn call-ups, and some stars are rested to manage workloads.

title: Jared Goffâ€™s wife Christen shares how motherhood inspired home makeovers
content: Christen Goff is navigating motherhood by creating two distinct yet personal homes in Los Angeles and Michigan for her and daughter Romy.  She thoughtfully designs each space to reflect its location and their evolving family identity.  Despite the challenges of a newborn and dual residences, Christen finds joy and belonging in this new chapter.

title: Suspecting affair, quit job: Bengaluru-based techie shoots wife after receiving divorce notice
content: A harrowing event transpired in Bengaluru as a software developer allegedly took his estranged wife's life in broad daylight during rush hour. The victim, who worked as a bank assistant manager, was relocating home with their kids when the altercation erupted. The accused, 40 years old, subsequently surrendered to the police with the weapon.

title: YouTuber under ED lens flew over 130 guests for Dubai for his cruise wedding
content: A UP-based YouTube influencer, Anurag Dwivedi, facing ED money-laundering probes for alleged ties to illegal betting, reportedly spent crores on a lavish Dubai destination wedding for over 130 guests. The lavish affair aboard a cruise ship, including flights and luxury stays, has drawn significant official scrutiny. The ED has seized assets worth an estimated Rs 20 crore.

title: T.N. Forest dept. curbs tourist entry at Thalakundha amid onset of ground frost
content: According to Forest department officials, tourism in the area has exploded over the past week, after a number of people began posting videos and pictures online of ground frost carpeting the Thalakundha area

title: High Court quashes FIR against TV executives over â€˜casteist dialogueâ€™
content: Case stemmed from an episode of the serial 'Laxmi versus Saraswati', which allegedly contained a dialogue insulting to the Scheduled Caste community

title: Vande Bharat hits overturned autorickshaw near Varkala in Kerala
content: No injuries to train passengers reported. The autorickshaw was unattended and the driver was later nabbed in an intoxicated state

title: Did an ancient Vaigai flood contribute to Keezhadiâ€™s abandonment?
content: According to new research, some urban-like structures at Keezhadi were likely buried a little over a thousand years ago â€” around 1,155 years before present in scientistsâ€™ phrasing â€” and this burial was related to a high-energy flood event that deposited sands and then finer silts and clays on the floodplain

title: Why is government pushing through 'fatally flawed' redefinition of Aravallis, asks Congress
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said the redefinition of the Aravallis was opposed by the Forest Survey

title: Army JCO killed in firing incident in J&K's Samba
content: The incident occurred late Tuesday (December 23) night and is under investigation, they said, ruling out any terror angle behind the shooting

title: Business events that shaped India in 2025
content: From Trumpâ€™s trade war to RBI repo rate cuts and major corporate entries, 2025 delivered several notable developments. Though not all were transformational, a few deserve closer attention. Read onâ€¦

title: Telangana DCA busts unlicensed medical device manufacturing unit; dialysis kits, sterile eye drapes found at site
content: The company was manufacturing Risk Class B medical devices - which are low-to-moderate risk healthcare products that come into direct contact with patients and therefore require strict quality control

title: Protests erupt after RSS-BJP manâ€™s alleged attack on childrenâ€™s Christmas carol group in Keralaâ€™s Palakkad
content: RSS-BJP worker Aswin Raj allegedly assaulted the children and damaged their musical instrument. The police have arrested him

title: Avalanche warning issued for five districts in J&K
content: The low danger avalanche warning has been issued for Doda, Ganderbal, Kishtwar, Poonch and Ramban districts

title: Two militants among six arrested in Manipur
content: â€œOne active cadre of the banned Prepak (G-5) was apprehended from Keibi Heikak Mapan in Imphal East district on Tuesday (December 24, 2025),â€ says a police statement

title: Internal dissent within Congress over selection of Kochi mayor candidate intensifies
content: KPCC general secretary and two-time councillor Deepthi Mary Varghese alleges selection process â€˜discrepanciesâ€™

title: NCP leader kidnapped, assaulted over financial dispute in Nanded district; seven held
content: Jeevan Ghogare, former leader of opposition in Nanded Municipal Corporation, has accused MLA Prataprao Chikhalikar, who represents the Loha Assembly seat in the district, of orchestrating the attack

title: Rooftop solar plants commissioned at 148 stations across South Western Railway
content: Major stations equipped with rooftop solar facilities include Krantiveera Sangolli Rayanna (KSR) Bengaluru Railway Station at Majestic, Hubballi, Mysuru, Dharwad, Belagavi, Hosapete, Gadag and Ballari.

title: Girl 'raped and murdered' in Odishaâ€™s Bhadrak; locals stage protest
content: Local people staged a road blockade at Baligaon on Tuesday night, demanding immediate arrest of those involved in the crime

title: How Indian States are following a pro-incumbency trend
content: Examples from around the world indicate how structural pressures, economic strain, social churn, and an anti-elite sentiment are producing different electoral logics.  But in Indiaâ€™s States, governments have got re-elected, often through welfare-driven incumbencies

title: Internet suspended in Assamâ€™s Karbi Anglong, West Karbi Anglong amid unrest
content: The notification stated that the Government of Assam received reports from the District Magistrates of Karbi Anglong and West Karbi Anglong on December 23 of a serious "law and order" situation in two districts

title: Bengal Governor orders inquiry into firing of starter gun at marathon run in Kolkata
content: It also noted that minor splinters or particle-like fragments were emitted from the starter gun upon firing, but confirmed that no injury was caused to the Governor or anyone else present at the venue.

title: India tops global doping list for third consecutive year | Data
content: Global comparisons show that despite more rigorous testing regimes, the doping rate is much lower in many other countries

title: â€˜Biggest fugitivesâ€™ Lalit Modi, Vijay Mallya captured on London party video
content: â€œWe are the two fugitives, the biggest fugitives of India,â€ Lalit Modi, the founding commissioner of the Indian Premier League (IPL), can be heard saying in the video.

title: The struggle to have a memorial after Ambedkar in Chennai
content: During then Chief Minister M. Karunanidhiâ€™s stint as CM of the State, he got an arts and science college in Vyasarpadi in north Chennai named after Ambedkar

title: How T.N. Seshanâ€™s airport arrival led to standoff with Jayalalithaa and attack on a star hotel
content: In the morning on November 27, 1994, the then Chief Election Commissioner of India T.N. Seshan landed at Madras Airport from New Delhi. What should have been a routine arrival quickly turned into a standoff with Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Jayalalithaa.

title: VP Radhakrishnan welcomes AI in school curricula, says India should take lead
content: Vice President C.P. Radhakrishnan said on Tuesday that artificial intelligence should be incorporated into school curricula, and that India should be striving to reach the top of the field

title: Vizag will become data centre hub and Amaravati quantum hub says Naidu
content: Chief Minister highlights Visakhapatnamâ€™s strong subsea cable connectivity and digital infrastructure which are positioning it as a key node in the global data ecosystem; Tirupati is being developed as a Space City, while regions such as Anantapur and Kadapa will evolve into major electronics and aerospace hubs, he adds

title: Bombay HC directs Maharashtra govt to pay â‚¹50 lakh benefit to COVID duty staffâ€™s family
content: The court invokes societal gratitude for frontline workers, calls for generous interpretation ofÂ schemesÂ to provide tangible relief to families who suffered immense hardships during the pandemic

title: Record rise in admissions to private schools under RTE in U.P., says govt.
content: Over the last five years, the total number of students securing admission to private schools under the scheme has more than doubled, a statement said

title: Strict action for New Year violations; special drunk driving checks from Wednesday
content: Hyderabad CP says riders/motorists caught drunk will face vehicle seizure, a fine of â‚¹10,000, six-month jail term and even permanent cancellation of driving licences

title: Deepthy Mary Varghese voices displeasure over being overlooked for Mayorâ€™s post

title: J&K HC dismisses Mehboobaâ€™s PIL on undertrials; says courts cannot serve as forums for electoral campaigns
content: The court said that the PIL was grounded in ambiguity and rested on incomplete, vague and unsubstantiated assertions. The jurisdiction of PIL could not be invoked based on generalised claims without naming affected persons, challenging specific orders or placing verifiable material on record

title: Bombay HC rejects bail pleas of four accused in Palghar lynching case, cites gravity of roles
content: The court saidÂ liberty â€œcannot be absolute in everyÂ situationâ€;Â directs CBI to completeÂ probe swiftly as applicantsÂ remainÂ in custody for over fiveÂ years

title: 95 lakh names deleted from rolls of three States, one UT
content: The voters whose names have been deleted can apply for re-inclusion. The electoral officers will take a final decision on the applications, and the final rolls will be issued on February 14

title: 22 CPI (Maoist) cadres surrender in Odisha

title: West Bengal govt. suppressing peaceful protests over violence against Hindus in Bangladesh: BJP
content: The attacks on the community in Bangladesh had deeply hurt and angered Hindus in India, prompting peaceful demonstrations in various parts of the country, BJP MP and spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi said

title: NCP-SP to contest Mumbai polls with MVA, says party
content: For the first time, NCP-SP has spoken about contesting the Mumbai polls as part of the MVA; till now, the Shiv Sena, NCP-SP, and Congress have been exploring other arrangements for the polls

title: Bank officer shot dead by estranged husband at Rajajinagar in Bengaluru
content: The couple had married in 2011, but had been living separately for the past one-and-a-half years due to marital discord

title: Trade unions call for strike against new Labour Codes, rural work law on February 12
content: Ten CTUs, alleged that the changes in the laws are a multi-pronged attack on peopleâ€™s rights; a national convention of workers, scheduled on January 9, will formally ratify the call to strike

title: Indiaâ€™s first anti-terror policy to be released soon

content: Kyiv has accused Russia of repeatedly targeting the facility, the site of a 1986 meltdown that is still the worldâ€™s worst ever nuclear disaster, since Moscow invaded in February 2022

title: Work to widen road atop Jawadhu Hills in Tiruvannamalai begins

title: 42.7 lakh voters deleted from Madhya Pradesh draft roll after SIR
content: Of the 42.74 lakh, 8.46 lakh are dead, 31.51 lakh were absent or had migrated, and 2.77 lakh people were registered as voters in more than one place, the Election Commission said

title: Film chamber to stop distributing movies in theatres under KSFDC from January
content: The apex body of film organisations in the Malayalam film industry had earlier deferred its strike, announced from June 1, 2025, following an assurance from Minister for Culture Saji Cherian that the government would consider its demands

title: Low temperature and frost lead to loss for tea sector in Munnar
content: A large quantity of tea leaves have wilted owing to the frost. Once it melts, tender leaf buds dry up under the sun. Plucking then cannot be resumed for another three months, leading to substantial loss

title: Nitin Nabin calls Rahul Gandhi a part-time politician

title: Clayton Kershaw and wife welcome fifth baby, Chloe Peach
content: the former los Angeles Dodgers pitcher announced he will retire at the end of the 2025 season . he shared a post with his new daughter, Chloe Peach Kershaw, alongside his wife and four children . the three-time world series champion announced during an interview on the "Sunday Night Baseball" broadcast on June 15 .

title: NFL playoff-clinching scenarios: What's at stake for nine teams in Week 17?
content: eight more teams punched their ticket into the postseason during week 16 of 2025 . 10 of 14 teams have qualified for the playoffs with two weeks to go . five AFC teams and four NFC teams have a chance to secure something this week .

title: Transfer portal: Tracking who intends to move
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: LeBron vs. Dillon Brooks: 'Social media junkie' to 'Help the bear' and everything between
content: the los Angeles lakers and Phoenix Suns have split two matchups this season . the two have had their fair share of battles on the court, but all comes down to competition . leBron James and Dillon Brooks will meet again on tuesday in Phoenix .

title: From Lane Kiffin to Pat Fitzgerald, we rank every FBS coaching hire
content: former Nebraska quarterback Scott Frost returned to Lincoln to save a flailing cornhuskers program . he went 16-31 and was fired early in his fifth season . former Ohio State player and longtime Buckeyes assistant Luke Fickell took the Wisconsin head coaching job .

title: The 25 most college football moments of the 21st century
content: college football slips so easily into pure chaos after all the on-field heroics . college football is a celebration not of the sublime but of the ridiculous . it has to be a little bit weird, colorless, color-coded moment .

title: Metcalf's 2-game ban upheld, will forfeit $555K
content: dK Metcalf will sit out the final two games of the regular season . he will forfeit $555,556 in salary . the suspension also voids $45 million in future guaranteed money, according to his contract .

title: 2026 NFL Pro Bowl AFC, NFC rosters: The league's top players
content: the rosters are set for the 2026 NFL Pro Bowl Games . the Baltimore Ravens, Denver Broncos , San Francisco 49ers and Seattle Seahawks lead the way with each having six players chosen . this year's games include a skills competition and a 7-on-7 flag football game scheduled for Feb. 3 .

title: Historic! Isro launches US comsat BlueBird Block-2; heaviest payload launched by LVM3 â€” why it matters
content: it was the heaviest payload lifted by the rocket which completed its sixth operational flight . it achieved an orbit of 518.5km against the planned 520km orbit . the 43.5m tall and 640tonne rocket lifted off from the second launch pad .
